definition: lit. above are the elderly, below are the young (idiom)/fig. to have to take care of both one's aging parents and one's children/sandwich generation
pinyin: shang4 you3 lao3 xia4 you3 xiao3

definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
small/tiny/few/young

sentences.english: Many Chinese families are part of a sanwich generation.
sentences.chinese: 許多中國家庭都處於上有老下有小的階段。

sentences.english: He also is to go up have next old having small Everyman.
sentences.chinese: 他也是上有老下有小的普通人。

definition: to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
pillar/backbone
(coll.) to live with and depend on one's parents even upon reaching adulthood
to get married and start a career (idiom)/to settle down/to establish oneself
(jocularly) to be under great pressure (a pun on 亞歷山大|亚历山大[Ya4 li4 shan1 da4])
to support/to provide support for/to maintain
to buy a house on a mortgage/house mortgage
old/aged
to support a family/to raise a family
cry piteously for food
the old and the young/the youngest member of the family
an only child
to settle down and get married (of a man)/to become a recognized expert
aged thirty (see 三十而立)
heavy burden/difficult task/great responsibility
car slave, sb forced to sacrifice quality of life to buy or maintain a car
